name: RWA Management
description: Comprehensive evaluation template for Real World Assets tokenization and management in Web3
author: Shai Perednik

categories.name: Asset Tokenization
categories.description: Evaluation of asset tokenization process and technology implementation

metrics.name: Valuation Methodology
metrics.description: Robustness of asset valuation methodology and price oracle implementation

thresholds.T0: Advanced multi-source valuation framework with independent third-party verification; integration with multiple high-quality oracles with failover mechanisms; price feeds update frequently with minimal lag; implements outlier detection and manipulation protection mechanisms
thresholds.T1: Basic valuation methodology with at least one reliable pricing source; reasonable price update frequency; some validation mechanisms in place

metrics.name: Tokenization Process
metrics.description: Efficiency and security of the tokenization process and smart contract implementation

thresholds.T0: Audited, secure tokenization infrastructure with automated compliance checks; seamless technical process from asset onboarding to token issuance; multiple professional security audits; formal verification where applicable; comprehensive documentation and transparency
thresholds.T1: Basic tokenization workflow with standard security measures; at least one professional audit; reasonable documentation of the process

metrics.name: Asset Verification & Title Legitimacy
metrics.description: Quality of asset verification process and legal title confirmation

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive verification system with legal documentation, proof of ownership, and chain of custody verification; immutable record of ownership history; integration with relevant legal registries; clear legal connection between token and underlying asset ownership
thresholds.T1: Basic verification procedures for ownership confirmation; some legal documentation required; standard title verification process

metrics.name: Token Standard & Interoperability
metrics.description: Quality of token standard implementation and cross-chain interoperability

thresholds.T0: Implementation of widely accepted token standards (ERC-20, ERC-721, etc.) with cross-chain compatibility; integration with multiple DeFi protocols; seamless bridging solutions; wallet compatibility across major platforms
thresholds.T1: Standard token implementation on a single major blockchain; limited interoperability with other platforms; basic wallet compatibility

categories.name: Market Liquidity
categories.description: Evaluation of RWA market liquidity management and secondary trading infrastructure

metrics.name: Liquidity Pools & Market Depth
metrics.description: Quality of liquidity pool implementation and overall market depth

thresholds.T0: Deep liquidity pools with substantial TVL; incentive mechanisms for liquidity providers; automated market making with minimal slippage; stability mechanisms during volatility; multiple DEX integrations; significant trading volume
thresholds.T1: Basic liquidity provision with reasonable depth; standard DEX listings; acceptable slippage levels for average trade sizes

metrics.name: Market Making Strategies
metrics.description: Effectiveness of market making strategies and price stability mechanisms

thresholds.T0: Professional market makers ensuring tight spreads; advanced algorithmic trading support; institutional liquidity partners; dynamic spread adjustment based on market conditions; robust arbitrage ecosystem
thresholds.T1: Basic market making with reasonable spreads; some programmatic trading support; modest arbitrage activity

metrics.name: Price Stability & Oracle Reliability
metrics.description: Effectiveness of price stability mechanisms and oracle reliability

thresholds.T0: Minimal price deviation from underlying asset value; circuit breakers or other volatility protection; time-weighted average price (TWAP) mechanisms; multi-oracle integration with aggregation logic; proven stability during market stress
thresholds.T1: Reasonable price alignment with underlying asset; basic price stabilization methods; standard oracle implementation with reasonable reliability

metrics.name: Secondary Trading Infrastructure
metrics.description: Quality of secondary market infrastructure and trading experience

thresholds.T0: Multiple high-quality trading venues (DEXs, CEXs); frictionless trading experience; high transaction throughput; minimal fees; cross-chain trading capabilities; trading API availability; institutional-grade trading tools
thresholds.T1: Basic trading venues with reasonable liquidity; standard trading interface; acceptable transaction costs and speeds

categories.name: Compliance & Governance
categories.description: Evaluation of RWA compliance, monitoring, and governance frameworks

metrics.name: Regulatory Framework
metrics.description: Completeness of regulatory framework and compliance with applicable laws

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive multi-jurisdictional compliance solution; partnership with leading legal firms; regulatory approvals in major jurisdictions; transparent compliance documentation; regular regulatory updates; proactive engagement with regulators
thresholds.T1: Basic regulatory compliance in primary jurisdiction; standard KYC/AML procedures; reasonable legal documentation; some regulatory clarity

metrics.name: Asset Tracking & Custody
metrics.description: Quality of asset tracking systems and custody solutions

thresholds.T0: Real-time asset tracking with immutable audit trail; institutional-grade custody solutions with insurance coverage; multi-signature security protocols; regular independent audits of underlying assets; transparent reporting
thresholds.T1: Basic asset tracking system; standard custody arrangements; periodic audits of underlying assets; reasonable security measures

metrics.name: Reporting & Transparency
metrics.description: Quality of reporting systems and overall transparency

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive real-time reporting dashboard; detailed asset performance metrics; transparent fee structure; automated compliance reporting; third-party verification of reports; complete audit trail
thresholds.T1: Basic periodic reporting; standard transparency regarding underlying assets; reasonable disclosure of fees and processes

metrics.name: Governance Model
metrics.description: Effectiveness and decentralization of the governance model

thresholds.T0: Well-designed DAO or governance system with clear voting mechanisms; balanced stakeholder representation; transparent governance proposals and execution; emergency response mechanisms; proven governance track record
thresholds.T1: Basic governance framework with some stakeholder input; reasonable transparency in decision-making; defined upgrade processes

categories.name: Risk Assessment
categories.description: Evaluation of RWA risk assessment and management frameworks

metrics.name: Credit Risk Assessment
metrics.description: Quality of credit risk assessment for debt-based RWAs

thresholds.T0: Sophisticated credit scoring models with multiple data sources; detailed counterparty risk analysis; stress testing under various scenarios; historical performance data; collateralization requirements; active monitoring of credit metrics
thresholds.T1: Basic credit assessment methodology; standard risk categorization; reasonable collateralization where applicable; periodic credit reviews

metrics.name: Market Risk Management
metrics.description: Effectiveness of market risk assessment and management

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive market risk models including VaR calculations; scenario analysis and stress testing; volatility monitoring; correlation risk assessment; automated risk mitigation strategies; proven effectiveness during market stress
thresholds.T1: Basic market risk monitoring; reasonable risk mitigation strategies; some stress testing capabilities

metrics.name: Operational Risk Management
metrics.description: Quality of operational risk assessment and mitigation strategies

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive operational risk framework covering smart contract, custody, oracle, and counterparty risks; regular security audits; bug bounty programs; business continuity planning; incident response protocols; insurance coverage
thresholds.T1: Basic operational risk monitoring; standard security practices; reasonable incident response capabilities

metrics.name: Legal & Regulatory Risk
metrics.description: Quality of legal and regulatory risk assessment and mitigation

thresholds.T0: Proactive legal risk management with ongoing monitoring of regulatory developments; multi-jurisdictional legal opinions; regulatory relationships; compliance automation; clear policies for regulatory change adaptation
thresholds.T1: Basic legal risk assessment; standard regulatory monitoring; reasonable policies for compliance

categories.name: User Experience & Accessibility
categories.description: Evaluation of RWA platform user experience and accessibility

metrics.name: Interface Quality & Usability
metrics.description: Quality and usability of the user interface for different user segments

thresholds.T0: Intuitive, professional-grade interface suitable for both retail and institutional users; mobile and desktop optimization; real-time data visualization; customizable dashboards; extensive documentation; multi-language support
thresholds.T1: Clean, functional interface; reasonable navigation; basic data visualization; standard documentation and support

metrics.name: Onboarding Process & KYC
metrics.description: Efficiency and user-friendliness of the onboarding and KYC/AML process

thresholds.T0: Streamlined onboarding with automated KYC/AML; quick verification times; institutional onboarding support; integration with identity verification services; compliant but minimally intrusive; clear status updates
thresholds.T1: Standard KYC/AML process with reasonable completion times; basic verification workflow; adequate user guidance

metrics.name: Redemption Process Efficiency
metrics.description: Efficiency and reliability of the token redemption process

thresholds.T0: Seamless redemption process with minimal delays; multiple redemption options; clear fee structure; automated redemption execution; robust liquidity reserves; proven reliability during high redemption periods
thresholds.T1: Standard redemption process with reasonable processing times; clear redemption instructions; adequate liquidity management

metrics.name: Educational Resources & Support
metrics.description: Quality and comprehensiveness of educational materials and support

thresholds.T0: Comprehensive educational content for various knowledge levels; interactive tutorials; webinars and workshops; responsive support channels (24/7); detailed documentation; community forums; expert advisory access
thresholds.T1: Basic educational materials; standard documentation; reasonable support response times; some community resources
